This is the one restaurant I return to time and time again. Beautiful soup dumplings. Staff are efficient but not personable. This is not something you should worry about as when you've queued for 30 mins to get a table you appreciate the efficiency of the place. Service is charged on all tables. They served tap water. Food is great.
Going back soon

Best place for Dumplings and just before Chinese New year. Attentive staff, overall good service at the busiest time of year. Even gave a discount when paying in cash.

Food won't blow your mind, but it's a bit cheaper than other chinese restaurants in the area.
The staff are not friendly but the dumplings are so fresh and the food is damn tasty. A staple in chinatown and highly recommended

I had sour soup (starter portion) and pork&vegetable dumplings. Both meals were very tasty. Service was also very good and quick. Pity that the place doesn't serve any desserts after 11PM. My friend and I really wanted something sweet.

Quality Dumplings with  wide variety of choice.
Recommend the spicy dumplings.
Food taste Good, but customer service isn't the best part here.
Great food and great service. I'll come again.

Food was ok. Service wasn't the best. They're in a hurry to rush through what you have to ask or say and that resulted in us having to ask for things multiple times! We only went here cos it had a high hygiene rating.

The food is really really good. But the staff is so from another world. No smile, no politeness, no efford to make anyone feel good. The food is just put commentless on the table. At a neighbour table they asked for some sauce to go with â€¦
Always busy so don't expect to be allowed to chill here for longer than it takes you to eat. However the food is excellent, such tasty fresh dim sum at a pretty good price (considering its location).
Delicious dumplings, busy restaurant but quick service
Yummy. Service is not very keen on helping you but the food is amazing. It can get very busy so just try it at odd hours.
Great Food. Very busy and service not the fastest. But was Chinese New Year weekend, so maybe the reason!  Not sure how fast usually. Great food, kinda worth waiting for. Staff friendly

The dishes are good and some are very tasty. However, I've been consistently let down by the service. They've forgotten my order a few times and they can be quite rude/defensive sometimes, even though it's clearly written that I've ordered the dish. I've had to wait over an hour for a dish even though it was not crowded.

Great If you're out late night in central London and you happen to be near Chinatown. Dumplings are fantastic and it's pretty cheap. This is not a fancy restaurant though so see it as a casual place to eat. Kitchen usually closes at 2am.
Not impressed by service, quality of the dumplings were not as good as we expected

Really good food. Especially their dumplings, as you would expect. If you crave for some delicious Chinese - definitely pop in or order online. Probably would have ordered online if I didn't live that far as it tends to get a bit noisy in the restaurant.

Do not go!!!! Found a sticker (some order number) in my food nearly swallowed it. Slow and rude service. Spring rolls had nothing inside. Dumpling sauce tasted like bad whiskey. They Forgot some items we ordered. No apology when I mentioned â€¦

The vegetarian menu was disgusting. Really disappointed. I could have made nicer food at home. A lot of it was tasteless. Fried spring rolls with no vegetables inside, boiled broccoli with some mushrooms on top. Really don't know why it's so popular. Will never come back if you paid me.
